member.summary: A function that can be used to de-dupe strings during construction directly from internal buffers.

member.name: T:Sylvan.Data.Csv.BinaryEncoding
member.summary: Gets the binary encoding used when reading fields with GetBytes.

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.BinaryEncoding.Base64
member.summary: Reads values as base64, does not support whitespace in values.

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.BinaryEncoding.Hexadecimal
member.summary: Read values as hexadecimal, allows optional "0x" prefix.

member.name: T:Sylvan.Data.Csv.ResultSetMode
member.summary: Specifies how result sets are interpreted within a CSV file.

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.ResultSetMode.SingleResult
member.summary: The entire file is interpreted as a single result set.

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.ResultSetMode.MultiResult
member.summary: In multi result mode a new result set is identified by a change in column count. Empty lines are skipped between result sets.

member.name: T:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions
member.summary: Options for configuring a CsvDataReader.

member.name: M:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a CsvDataReaderOptions with the default values.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.ResultSetMode
member.summary: Indicates the behavior of result transitions.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.BinaryEncoding
member.summary: Indicates the binary encoding that should be used when writing binary columns.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.StringFactory
member.summary: A string factory function which can de-dupe strings on construction. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.ColumnStringFactory
member.summary: A string factory function which can de-dupe strings on construction. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.CommentHandler
member.summary: A callback method which will be called when a comment is found in the CSV.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.TrueString
member.summary: The string which represents true values when reading boolean. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.FalseString
member.summary: The string which represents false values when reading boolean. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.DateFormat
member.summary: The format string to use to parse dates. Defaults to null, in which case standard date parsing rules apply.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.DateTimeFormat
member.summary: The format string to use to parse DateTime values. Defaults to null, in which case standard date parsing rules apply.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.HasHeaders
member.summary: Specifies if the CSV data contains a header row with column names. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.Delimiter
member.summary: Specifies the field delimiter. By default, uses autodetect.
member.remarks: Setting the delimiter will disable auto-detection.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.Quote
member.summary: Specifies the character used for quoting fields. Defaults to '"'.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.Comment
member.summary: Specifies the character used to indicate a comment. Defaults to '#'.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.CsvStyle
member.summary: Indicates the CSV parsing style, defaults to Standard.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.Escape
member.summary: Specifies the character used for escaping characters in quoted fields. Defaults to '"'.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.BufferSize
member.summary: The size of buffer to use when reading records. A record must fit within a single buffer, otherwise an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.MaxBufferSize
member.summary: The maximum size the internal buffer will be allowed to grow.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.Buffer
member.summary: The buffer to use when reading records. The default is null, in which case the reader will allocate the buffer.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.HeaderComparer
member.summary: The StringComparer to use when looking up header values. Can be used to allow case-insensitive column lookup. The default is Ordinal.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.Culture
member.summary: The CultureInfo to use when parsing values in the CSV data. Defaults to the InvariantCulture.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.OwnsReader
member.summary: Indicates if the TextReader should be closed when the CsvDataReader is closed. The default is true.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataReaderOptions.Schema
member.summary: Allows specifying a strongly-typed schema for the CSV data.

member.name: T:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvStringQuoting
member.summary: Specifies how strings are quoted

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvStringQuoting.Default
member.summary: Strings are only quoted when it is required.

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvStringQuoting.AlwaysQuoteEmpty
member.summary: Empty strings are always quoted. This distinguishes them from null.

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvStringQuoting.AlwaysQuoteNonEmpty
member.summary: Non-empty strings are always quoted. This helps prevent confusion with numbers and dates.

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvStringQuoting.AlwaysQuote
member.summary: All strings are always quoted.

member.summary: Options for configuring a CsvWriter.

member.summary: Creates a CsvWriterOptions with the default values.

member.summary: Indicates the encoding format to use when writing binary columns.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.WriteHeaders
member.summary: Indicates if the header row should be written.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.TrueString
member.summary: The string to write for boolean true values. The default is "True".

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.FalseString
member.summary: The string to write for boolean false values. The default is "False".

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.DateTimeFormat
member.summary: The format string used when writing DateTime values. The default is \"O\".

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.DateTimeOffsetFormat
member.summary: The format string used when writing DateTimeOffset values. The default is \"O\".

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.DateFormat
member.summary: The format string used when writing DateTime values, or DateOnly values on supported frameworks, that have a time component. The default is \"O\".

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.TimeSpanFormat
member.summary: The format string used when writing TimeSpan values that have to time component. The default is \"c\".

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.Style
member.summary: The style of the CSV file to be written, defaults to .

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.Delimiter
member.summary: The delimiter to use between fields. The default is ','.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.QuoteStrings
member.summary: The rules to use when quoting strings, defaults to

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.QuoteEmptyStrings
member.summary: Empty strings will be written as empty quotes in the CSV. This allows distinguishing empty strings from null.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.Quote
member.summary: The character to use for quoting fields. The default is '"'.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.Escape
member.summary: The character to use for escaping in quoted fields fields. The default is '"'.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.Comment
member.summary: The character used to indicate a comment line. The default is '#'.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.NewLine
member.summary:
The string to use for line breaks separating records. The default is "
". Must be one of "", "
", or "
".

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.BufferSize
member.summary: The buffer size to use for writing values.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.MaxBufferSize
member.summary: The maximum size the internal buffer can grow to.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.Buffer
member.summary: The buffer to use when writing records. The default is null, in which case the writer will allocate a buffer of BufferSize.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvDataWriterOptions.Culture
member.summary: The CultureInfo to use when writing values. The default is the InvariantCulture.

member.summary: Gets a ICsvSchemaProvider that treats fields as "dynamic", where the data type can change from row to row.

member.summary: Creates a new CsvSchemaProvider.

member.summary: Creates a new CsvSchemaProvider.

A StringComparer used to match header names to the provided schema.

member.name: T:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvStyle
member.summary: The CSV quoting and escaping styles.

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvStyle.Standard
member.summary: Parses using the standard RFC4180 mode. Malformed fields will produce a during calls to .

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvStyle.Unquoted
member.summary: Interprets fields as if they are implicitly quoted. Delimiters and new lines within fields are preceded by an escape character.

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvStyle.Escaped
member.summary: Interprets fields as if they are implicitly quoted. Delimiters and new lines within fields are preceded by an escape character.

member.name: F:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvStyle.Lax
member.summary: Parses CSV using lax quote handling where incorrectly quoted fields don't produce an error. In this mode a field will be parsed using the mode, and when a (unescaped) closing quote is found, the remainder of the field will be parsed as if it were unquoted.

member.name: T:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvFormatException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when CSV data is malformed.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvFormatException.RowNumber
member.summary: The row number containing the malformed data.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvFormatException.FieldOrdinal
member.summary: The ordinal of the field containing the malformed data.

member.name: T:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvConfigurationException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the configuration options specify invalid options.

member.name: T:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvRecordTooLargeException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a single CSV record is too large to fit in the read buffer.
member.remarks: CsvRecordTooLargeException is typically an indication of a incorrectly formatted CSV file. Most CSV files should easily fit the constraints of the default buffer size. It is possible to increase the buffer size for exceptional cases

member.name: T:Sylvan.Data.Csv.CsvMissingHeadersException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when reading an empty CSV when headers are expected.

member.name: T:Sylvan.Data.Csv.AmbiguousColumnException
member.summary: The exception thrown when trying to get the ordinal for a column name that appears more than once.

member.name: P:Sylvan.Data.Csv.AmbiguousColumnException.Name
member.summary: Gets the the ambiguous column name.

member.summary: Provides the ability to specify a schema for a CsvDataReader.

member.summary: Gets the schema for a column with the given name and/or ordinal.

The zero-based ordinal of the column.

member.name: T:Sylvan.IsoDate
member.summary: Provides ISO 8601 date parsing and formatting.

member.name: M:Sylvan.IsoDate.TryParse(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Parse the given as extended ISO 8601 format.
member.param: The source to parse.
The parsed if successful.

member.name: M:Sylvan.IsoDate.TryParse(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.DateTimeOffset@)
member.summary: Parse the given as extended ISO 8601 format.
member.param: The source to parse.
The parsed if successful.

member.name: M:Sylvan.IsoDate.TryParseDateTimeOffset(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},Sylvan.IsoDate.DateTimeParseData@)
member.summary: ISO 8601 date time parser (ISO 8601-1:2019).
member.param: The date/time to parse in UTF-8 format.
The parsed for the given .
member.remarks:
Supports extended calendar date (5.2.2.1) and complete (5.4.2.1) calendar date/time of day representations with optional specification of seconds and fractional seconds.
Times can be explicitly specified as UTC ("Z" - 5.3.3) or offsets from UTC ("+/-hh:mm" 5.3.4.2). If unspecified they are considered to be local per spec.
Examples: (TZD is either "Z" or hh:mm offset from UTC)
YYYY-MM-DD (eg 1997-07-16) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm (eg 1997-07-16T19:20) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:30) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.s (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:30.45) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20+01:00) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:3001:00) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:30.45Z)
Generally speaking we always require the "extended" option when one exists (3.1.3.5). The extended variants have separator characters between components ('-', ':', '.', etc.). Spaces are not permitted.

member.name: M:Sylvan.IsoDate.TryCreateDateTimeOffset(System.DateTime,Sylvan.IsoDate.DateTimeParseData@,System.DateTimeOffset@)
member.summary: Overflow-safe DateTimeOffset factory.

member.name: M:Sylvan.IsoDate.TryCreateDateTimeOffset(Sylvan.IsoDate.DateTimeParseData@,System.DateTimeOffset@)
member.summary: Overflow-safe DateTimeOffset factory.

member.name: M:Sylvan.IsoDate.TryCreateDateTimeOffsetInterpretingDataAsLocalTime(Sylvan.IsoDate.DateTimeParseData,System.DateTimeOffset@)
member.summary: Overflow-safe DateTimeOffset/Local time conversion factory.

member.name: M:Sylvan.IsoDate.ToStringIso(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets a DateTime value as an ISO 8601 formatted string.

member.name: M:Sylvan.IsoDate.TryFormatIso(System.DateTime,System.Span{System.Char},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Tries to write the Datetime value as an ISO 8601 formatted string.

member.name: M:Sylvan.IsoDate.ToStringIso(System.DateTimeOffset)

member.name: M:Sylvan.IsoDate.WriteFourDigits(System.UInt32,System.Span{System.Char},System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a value [ 0000 .. 9999 ] to the buffer starting at the specified offset. This method performs best when the starting index is a constant literal.
